questions.question: What is the empirical formula of the compound that crystallizes in the tetragonal P4 space group with cell dimensions a=18.2715(3), b=18.2715(3), c=17.0912(3), and has a calculated volume of 5705.86(17) Å³?
Which compound exhibits the highest Langmuir surface area according to experimental nitrogen adsorption isotherms at 77K?
questions.answer: Compound 2 exhibits the highest Langmuir surface area of 2650 m²/g.

questions.question: What is the hydrogen uptake at 77 K and 1 atm for the compound with a Langmuir surface area of 2486 m²/g?
questions.answer: The hydrogen uptake at 77 K and 1 atm for the compound with a Langmuir surface area of 2486 m²/g is 2.5 wt%.

questions.question: For the compound synthesized using the octa-carboxylate ligand (R)-L1-H8, what is the percentage of solvent accessible volume calculated by PLATON?
questions.answer: The percentage of solvent accessible volume for the compound synthesized using (R)-L1-H8 is not directly provided in the text.

questions.question: Which compound has shown a discrepancy between experimental and GCMC simulated Langmuir surface areas, and what might be the reason?
questions.answer: Compound 3 showed a discrepancy between experimental (1841 m²/g) and GCMC simulated (2134 m²/g) Langmuir surface areas, possibly due to the flexible and disordered nature of the bulky benzyloxy groups.

questions.question: True or False: The PXRD patterns of the evacuated samples of compounds 1, 2, and 3 are essentially the same as those of the pristine samples.
True or False: The synthesis of the octa-carboxylate ligand (R)-L1-H8 involves a Pd-catalyzed Suzuki coupling reaction.
What is the effect of substituting ethoxy groups with benzyloxy groups on the pore sizes of the resulting MOFs?
questions.answer: Substituting ethoxy groups with benzyloxy groups reduces the open channel sizes due to the bulkier nature of benzyloxy groups.

questions.question: True or False: The compound synthesized using (R)-L3-H8 exhibits the lowest hydrogen uptake at 77 K and 1 atm among the compounds discussed.
What is the role of copper paddle-wheel building units in the construction of the MOFs discussed?
questions.answer: Copper paddle-wheel building units serve as 4-connected nodes that link with octa-carboxylate ligands to form the MOFs' structure.
